item.title: By: Doan
item.dc:creator: Doan
item.description:
Hi Andrew,
I've done every thing until this step :Adding Scale-Out with Sharding. I don't understand why you must create another global_group (global-group) and why don't you use the global_group-1 to create sharding. And when I tried the command: mysqlfabric group activate group_id-1 , I got the error: DatabaseError: Command (REPLACE INTO shard_maps(type_name, global_group) VALUES(%s, %s), ('HASH', 'global_group-1')) failed accessing (localhost:3306). 1452 (23000): Cannot add or update a child row: a foreign key constraint fails (`fabric`.`shard_maps`, CONSTRAINT `fk_shard_mapping_global_group` FOREIGN KEY (`global_group`) REFERENCES `groups` (`group_id`)).
Please kindly answer for me, Thanks, your post is so great.

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/mysql-fabric/mysql-fabric-adding-high-availability-and-scaling-to-mysql#comment-495539">Pavan Kumar Mekala</a>.
The ports can be configured for each MySQL Server (default to 3306) and the Fabric node (defaults to 32274).
Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Pavan Kumar Mekala.

The ports can be configured for each MySQL Server (default to 3306) and the Fabric node (defaults to 32274).

Andrew.

item.title: By: andrew

item.description:
In reply to <a href="/mysql-fabric/mysql-fabric-adding-high-availability-and-scaling-to-mysql#comment-215793">Tim</a>.

Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Tim.

Hi Tim,

The Fabric user needs permission to control replication and to read/write to the fabric database.

Andrew.
